reviews.text: It is an okay station, as people have been mentioning it is not the most secure facilities I know when I have been to this station people have just walked into the train station with no tickets from off the pedestrian crossing, climbed over the fences etc. Did not feel 100% safe but that's because I know the area and what it is like unfortunately. Good enough station if the train comes quick and you do not need to use the facilities
Great - quick to get through no struggles

Frequent services to London but security is still an issue... especially if travelling on trains after 9pm... more work required on the station and the surrounding areas to enhance lighting and to reduce crime...

Check your ticket carefully! Staff seem to have a problem with Barking. Have had problems 3 times.
1-ticket was rejected at the barrier. Had wrong date on it
2-Asked for a return ticket and got a single
3-ticket rejected at the barrier. Had Barking as my outward journey instead of Grays.
On the plus side, for all seniors over 65 who don't know about it, you can travel all day between Upminster and Shoeburyness for £6 with an over 65 rover ticket.
